data.title: L. Sprague de Camp; Lin Carter Book List
data.meta_description: A complete list of all L. Sprague de Camp; Lin Carter's books in order (6 books). Browse plot descriptions, book covers, genres, pseudonyms, ratings and awards.
data.text:
Conan the Barbarian

1967

/ Heroic Fantasy / Sword & Sorcery

OUT OF A DARK AGE UNDREAMED OF COMES THE GREATEST WARRIOR OF ALL TIME. He is Conan. The fate of kingdoms balances on his bloody blade. The story begins as the young Conan witnesses the brutal slaying of his parents by Thulsa Doom, chief of the evi...

Conan of the Isles

1968

/ Heroic Fantasy / Sword & Sorcery

"Conan struck the water with a mighty splash. Green waves closed over his head. Weighted by the chain mail that clothed his body to mid-thigh and by the massive broadsword in his fist, he sank like a stone. . . ." The bravest, most daring, most ex...

Conan of Cimmeria

1969

/ Heroic Fantasy / Sword & Sorcery

Conan in his most savage adventures! "When he twisted his bullneck to look upward, the blood froze in Conan's veins. The mist that had obscured the top of the pylon was gone. The rising half moon shone on and through an amorphous thing, which squa...

Conan the Buccaneer

1971

/ Heroic Fantasy / Sword & Sorcery

"Conan stood silently at the quarterdeck rail as the Wastrel veered into strange waters. With only the pole star to guide him, what might he encounter in that darkly glittering immensity? What fabulous isles and unknown peoples? Only his prey, the ev...

Conan of Aquilonia

1977

/ Heroic Fantasy / Sword & Sorcery

Mighty Conan in a fight to the death against the most dangerous fiends of the Hyborian Age! Hunting the swift stag and the tusked boar in the gloomy forests of the Gunderland Marches, Conan loses his son Conn to Thoth- Amon and the supremely evil ...

Conan the Liberator

Feb-1979

/ Heroic Fantasy / Sword & Sorcery

The hour of darkness was upon Aquilonia, proudest kingdom of the great Hyborian world. Brave men cowered, for a madman wore the crown. Now mighty Conan, sword in hand, girded himself for a terrible confrontation. Chosen commander-in-chief of the rebe...
